91021001-d-02-10-91-WCRC.Narrative: WCRC ENGINE WESTBOUND FREIGHT WITH TWO OTHER ENGINES IN THE CONSIST AND 22 LOADS, 64 EMPTIES, 5204 TONS STOPPED ON THE MAIN TRACK AT KENNEWICK, WA. THE HEAD TEN CARS WERE CUT OFF TO BE SET OUT TO THEKENNEWICK PASS. THERE WERE 8 LOADS AND 2 EMPTIES ON THE WEST END OF THE PASS AT THIS TIME. THE WESTCAR ON THE PASS WAS STRADDLING THE BEET SPUR SWITCH WHICH COMES OFF THE PASS. THE BEET SPUR SWITCH WAS IMPROPERLY LINED FOR THE BEET SPUR UNDERNEATH THE LEAD CAR. AFTER COUPLING INTO THE CARS ON THE PASS THE TRAINMAN PROCEEDED TO THE REAR OF THE CARS WITHOUT INSPECTING THE SWITCH AND GAVE THE ENGINEER THE SIGNAL TO BACK UP. THE TRAIN BACKED UP AND THE EAST END OF BN 577592 WENT DOWN THE PASSING TRACK WITH THE CARS ON THE PASS AND THE WEST END WENT INTO THE BEET SPUR WITH THE CARS COUPLED TO THEENGINE. THE BN 577529 PULLED THE BEET SPUR AND PASS TRACKS TOGETHER AND DERAILED, CONTACTING 5 CARSTHAT WERE SITTING ON THE BEET SPUR. IT TURNED SIDEWAYS AND CONTACTED TWO CARS, TEN CARS DEEP IN THEREMAINDER OF THE TRAIN SITTING ON THE MAIN TRACK BEFORE STOPPING. IN ALL, THREE OF THE CARS ON THE PASS WERE DERAILED, TWO ON THE BEET SPUR AND TWO ON THE MAIN TRACK.NoneNoneNone

DK0073-d-02-02-91-BN.Narrative: TRAIN 01211 HAD HOLD OF 41 CARS SHOVING EASTWARD FROM NO.2 TRACK INTO NO.5 TRK. AIR ON CARS HAD NOTCOMPLETELY RELEASED, AND SOME HAND BRAKES WERE STILL SET, CAUSING BN575451 & 3 OTHER CARS TO JACKKNIFE ON THE NO.4 TRK SWITCH, FOULING YARD TRKS NO.1 AND NO.2. NO INVESTIGATION SCHEDULED. INVESTIGATION BY DIV. OFFCRS. REVEALED THAT 2 UNITS & 41 CARS WERE COUPLED TO 38 CARS. THE AIR WAS CUT IN, & THEENGR BEGAN TO SHOVE THE TRK BEFORE THE AIR RELEASED COMPLETELY. ENGR WAS IN THROTTLE POSITION NO.6,& USING 1,000 AMPS, CAUSING EXCESSIVE BUFF FORCES AT TURNOUT ON NO.4 TRK, RESULTING IN 4 CARS DERAILING. THE LIGHT TO ILLUMINATE THE AMP GUAGE WAS NOT WORKING, HOWEVER, THIS WAS NOT THE PRIMARY OR CONTRIBUTING CAUSE OF THE ACCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
